title: Why Ionia
body:
Why does Riot love Ionia? It’s honestly the most generic area in runeterra yet they keep getting all this lore, characters, and cinematics and honestly I’m just tired. We get it. Akali is sassy. Irelia is STRONK. Yasuo is Yasuo. 
If we had more Jhin stuff then I’m fine with it but nope. You had to shove in Akali and Kayn in the comic. Bad enough we barely get any Noxus or Void stuff(actual void stuff, not just Kaisa) Remember the conflict with Kass and Malz? Hell do you guys even remember that you have champs like Yi who gets no love in anything? Wasn’t he your star character years ago? 
That Darius comic was great! Why stop there? “Alright guys we added in one Noxus character. That’s our quota so let’s make skins for Akali and make another Ionian champ” 
Hell even Ekko and the Shadow Isles will get their own game!

Remember The Black Rose?
What’s going on with Morde and Noxus?
Remember General DuCouteau? Talon just stopped looking for him right? Is he dead? Oh no that’s not important. Garen and Kat making love jokes is important! You still haven’t made that official btw. The teasing is annoying. None of the Ionian champs have any personality besides Jhin and the ones who live in the damn jungle like Rakan. Says a lot about Ionia. 
Can’t wait for the 20th Akali skin.

replies.body:
I agree that Ionia needs to take a backseat, however I can understand why Ionia is getting so much focus. I mean:

* Ionia is the faction who has probably the most subfactions and a lot of them are still unexplored.

* Ionia is probably the faction with the most meaningful history for it, the nouxs invasion changed a lot and there are tons of people being affected by it in different ways in ionia, other factions have their history too, but its usually one big event that lies way back in the past.

* The vastaya are of ionian origin, so it makes sense for any vastaya champ or vastaya related champ to be ionian.

*  Ionia doesn't just take inspiriation from japanese culture, but most asian cultures in general, meaning there is a wide variety of themes to draw from. Most other factions themes are mostly based on one countrys culture or have to share their theme with others(There are tons of european medieval themes, but Noxus and Demacia both draw from them).

Not to mention that the asian market is also pretty big, so ionia likely relates to that the most.

The thing about Ionia having the most factions is a direct consequence of Riot's behaviour to keep developing Ionia while neglecting other regions of their world.

All the other regions could easily have as many factions as Ionia or even more, if Riot simply would put in the effort to develop these regions further by champion releases correlated with new factions.

____________________________

Riot clearly has an Ionia bias when it comes to champion releases, that is obvious. Maybe it has to do with the market, maybe the designers in their teams are simply more excited about investigating Ionian themes, I don't know. But it can't really be denied that the bias is there if Ionia already has 19 champions in total while over half of the regions in game can't even break the 10 champion threshold.

Also they kinda have shown that Ionia gets alot of special treatment.
When we got Urgot and Warwick as VGUs from Zaun, Riot told us that they are taking a break now from Zaunite thematics because they have released these 2 so close to one another.

Which I thought is fine back then. Then the same happens with Ionia, Akali and Irelia get reworked close to each other. Such statement that they will take a break from Ionia has never been made.
Other regions have to wait up to 6 years for a new champion release, Ionia never had a waiting time even close to that one. And Ionia can still claim to be the only region which got **3 champion releases back to back** with Kayn, Xayah, and Rakan.

________________________________

It just feels really discouraging as a fan of other regions of the game to see that Ionia is getting so much more love than any other part of their world.

Ionia lends itself a bit more towards having tons of subfactions though, because all the other factions either have either a central city(or are just one city). The only exception outside of Ionia(and Bandle and the void, who are more like places of origin) is the freljord, but even there you've got 3 main tribes.
But Ionia doesn't have that, its very base structure is made up of small subfactions.

With that being said, I do think that they could start to put more focus on some of the subfactions of the other factions(like Buhru in Bilgewater, the fighters pit in Noxus, or heck any of the noxian/demacian territories that aren't the main city). It will likely not be as many as Ionia has, but there can certainly be done more with them.

And I agree that ultimately Riot is biased. The most egregious thing about that statement, about taking a break from Zaun due to it getting 2 reworks in a row, was that it was made after ionia got 3 new champions in a row and was followed up by ionia getting 2 VGUs in the next year.

*sigh* at least Ionia didn't get anything big in 2019....

I don't really get why you think that having a capital (or as a region be a city like Zaun and Piltover) necessarily means that there is less potential for subfactions.

For example, if you consider the 3 tribes of Freljord as own subfactions, then literally every big clan of Piltover and every Chembaron of Zaun can be considered an own subfaction. They are constantly rivaling each other, fighting for power in the city, sabotaging each other, killing....
It just happens that Riot simply did not go into that route yet. We still don't have a single Chembaron champion in the game.

The only Piltovan clan that is represented in the game is Ferros since the introduction of Camille.

_______________

That's what I mean. There definitely is potential for tons of subfactions in other regions. It just happened that Riot has chosen to develop Ionia further, giving us details about many subfactions, while they simply did not do the same for other regions.

The capital means that the majority of the champs are designed to be champs of the governing force.
For example most demacia-champs work for the crown and the ones that don't tend to be independent champs that don't belong to a subfaction.
Sure there are different orders within Demacias military, but those still belong to the Demacian military as a whole(they'd be like a subfaction within a subfaction).

You are right about Zaun and Piltover, I honestly didn't think too much about it since Riot has for now ignored the actual subfactions within those cities and instead tends to give us champs from there that aren't part of an important clan or organization. Anyway my point is that Ionia is easily among the factions with the most potential for subfactions, since it is made out of dozens of them.
There might be other factions who have just as much potential, but there are certainly factions with less potential for them.

Granted there are some factions that have a more recent event like this too, like Azirs rise, Demacias mage rebellion and Miss Fortune taking control over Bilgewater, but in these cases these events might have been too recent to affect the lives of many in a meaningful way.
